Punched, Dragged Each Other By Hair: Two School Girls Clash 'Over Same Boy' In UP - News18
summary:
Two School Girls Clash Over Boy in Uttar Pradesh

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: News18

Two teenage girls engaged in a public fight over the affections of the same boy in Baghpat, Uttar Pradesh, which was captured in a viral video.

  • The incident took place in Aminagar Sarai town.
  • Both girls are in Class 10 and were reportedly friends until they discovered their mutual feelings for a boy.
  • The altercation involved punching, kicking, and hair-pulling, with onlookers attempting to separate them.
  • The police have launched an investigation following the video's circulation on social media.
The police confirmed that they are looking into the incident after receiving the viral video.

This incident highlights the challenges young people face with interpersonal relationships and the resulting conflicts.
newTitle: Two School Girls Clash Over Boy in Uttar Pradesh

title: 'Land Mafias Wanted To Sell My Sisters': In Murder Video, UP Man Reveals Why He Killed Family - News18
summary:
Chilling Murder-Suicide: UP Man Kills Family, Blames Land Mafia and Neighbors

Date & Source: Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 20:11 IST

In a shocking turn of events, a 24-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh named Arshad murdered his mother and four sisters before sharing a video of the crime online. Arshad was later arrested at the crime scene in Lucknow.

The chilling video, which emerged hours after the murders, shows Arshad alleging that neighbors and land mafia in their hometown of Budaun had captured their house and planned to traffic his sisters. He claimed that he killed his family members to prevent this from happening.

  1. Arshad choked and slit the wrists of his mother and sisters.
  2. He blamed local land mafia and neighbors for harassing his family and capturing their house.
  3. Arshad requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for justice.

"I have killed my mother and sisters. When police get this video, they must know that the locals are responsible. They harassed us to capture our house. We raised our voice, but no one heard. It has been 15 days that we have been sleeping on the footpath, wandering in the cold. We don’t want the children to wander in the cold. They have captured our house. The documents are with us."
- Arshad

Arshad also claimed that his family wanted to live peacefully and had approached many people for help, but no one assisted them. He expressed fear that his sisters were dying and that he himself would not live much longer.
newTitle: Chilling Murder-Suicide: UP Man Kills Family, Blames Land Mafia and Neighbors

title: Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In 2025, the Supreme Court of India will operate under three Chief Justices and will see the retirement of seven judges.

The Chief Justice of India (CJI), Justice Sanjiv Khanna, will step down on May 13, 2025, followed by Justice BR Gavai and Justice Surya Kant assuming future leadership positions.

  • Justice CT Ravikumar retires on January 5.
  • Justice Hrishikesh Roy retires on January 31.
  • CJI Sanjiv Khanna retires on May 13.
  • Justice Abhay Sreeniwas Oka retires on May 24.
  • Justice Bela Trivedi retires on June 9.
  • Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia retires on August 9.
  • Justice BR Gavai retires on November 23.
“The Supreme Court will witness significant changes with multiple retirements and a transition in leadership.”

This upcoming succession in the Supreme Court is crucial for understanding the future judicial landscape.
newTitle: Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025

title: Stuck In Rajasthan Borewell For 10 Days, 3-Year-Old Dies Hours After Rescue - NDTV
summary:
Tragic Death of 3-Year-Old Rescued After 10 Days in Rajasthan Borewell

Date & Source: December 24, 2022, from a reliable news source.

In a tragic turn of events, a three-year-old girl named Chetna who fell into a borewell in Rajasthan's Kotputli 10 days ago, died shortly after she was rescued. Despite extensive efforts by national and state Disaster Relief Forces, the girl succumbed to her injuries.

  1. Chetna fell into the borewell while playing on the afternoon of December 23.Despite initial attempts to rescue her, the rescue teams faced challenges due to the borewell's tilted structure.The girl was rescued after five failed attempts and immediately shifted to a nearby hospital.However, she was pronounced dead upon examination.
Dayaram, Chetna's grandfather, praised the relentless efforts of the administration and rescue teams but urged authorities to cover open borewells to prevent similar tragedies.

This tragic incident highlights the importance of safety measures around open borewells and the need for swift and effective rescue operations.
newTitle: Tragic Death of 3-Year-Old Rescued After 10 Days in Rajasthan Borewell

title: Girl, 3, Rescued 10 Days After Falling Into 700-Foot Borewell In Rajasthan - NDTV
summary:
Miraculous Rescue: 3-Year-Old Girl Saved After 10 Days in 700-Foot Borewell

Date: December 23, 2022 | Source: NDTV

In a remarkable rescue operation, a three-year-old girl named Chetna was successfully pulled out from a 700-feet deep borewell in Rajasthan's Kotputli, 10 days after she had fallen in. Chetna was immediately hospitalized, and her condition is stable but being closely monitored.

  1. Chetna fell into the borewell on December 23 while playing.
  2. Disaster Relief Forces and a medical team were immediately deployed to rescue her.
  3. Initial attempts to pull her up failed, and a tunnel was dug in the wrong direction.
  4. After several failed efforts and with Chetna's condition deteriorating, she was finally rescued.

"Her condition will continue to be monitored," said hospital authorities.

This grueling rescue mission has been a test of human endurance and a tale of hope amidst despair.
newTitle: Miraculous Rescue: 3-Year-Old Girl Saved After 10 Days in 700-Foot Borewell

title: PPF: From 12% to 7.1% – Why this once sought-after tax-saving scheme no longer attracts middle-class investors | Mint - Mint
summary:
PPF: From 12% to 7.1% – Why this once sought-after tax-saving scheme no longer attracts middle-class investors

Publication Date: 2023-04-01

Source: Live Mint

The Public Provident Fund (PPF), a once-popular investment scheme, has seen its interest rate plummet from 12% to 7.1%. This decline in rates reflects broader shifts in the banking sector's interest offerings, making PPF less appealing for middle-class investors.

  • PPF allowed investments between ₹500 to ₹1.5 lakh annually.
  • Formerly offered a 12% interest rate, now reduced to 7.1%.
  • The scheme is government-backed, which contributed to its historical popularity.
  • Partial withdrawals allowed after five years.
  • Investment in PPF is exempt from income tax under section 80C for those opting for the old tax regime.
  • The shift to a new tax regime as of April 1, 2023, has impacted tax benefits associated with PPF.
“PPF offered a whopping 12 percent interest on investment before the turn of the century.”

Overall, the drop in interest rates and new tax regulations have diminished the appeal of PPF among middle-class investors, leading many to reconsider their investment strategies.
newTitle: PPF Interest Rates Drop from 12% to 7.1%: Impact on Middle-Class Investors

Govt begins land identification process for Manmohan Singh memorial - The Tribune India
summary:
Govt begins land identification process for Manmohan Singh memorial

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Tribune

The government has initiated the process to identify a site for a memorial dedicated to former prime minister Manmohan Singh and is actively consulting with his family to determine the location.

  • The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) has surveyed sites near the Sanjay Gandhi memorial and has identified potential spots for the memorial.
  • Consultations with Singh's family are ongoing, discussing three to four location options.
  • No definitive site has been chosen yet; everything will be finalized in collaboration with Singh's family.
  • A trust will be established before the selected land is allocated for the memorial.
  • Singh, known as the architect of India’s economic reforms, passed away on December 26 at the age of 92.
  • The cremation and subsequent memorial plans have sparked a political debate between BJP and Congress parties.
“The Congress criticised the government for holding his last rites at Nigambodh Ghat.”

The establishment of a memorial for Manmohan Singh reflects the government's acknowledgment of his contributions to India's economic landscape, though the process has been marked by political contention.
newTitle: Govt begins land identification process for Manmohan Singh memorial

title: Cabinet's first decision in New Year dedicated to farmers: PM Modi over crop insurance schemes - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Announces New Year Decision for Farmers on Crop Insurance Schemes

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The government, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, made its first decision of the New Year dedicated to farmers, enhancing budget allocations for crop insurance schemes and a key fertilizer subsidy.

  • The Cabinet approved significant increases in the crop insurance scheme allocation.
  • Continuing the 'Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana' and Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme until 2025-26.
  • The decision ensures risk coverage from natural calamities for farmers nationwide.
  • A one-time special package on Di-Ammonium Phosphate (DAP) was extended to make fertilizer accessible at affordable prices.
  • The total outlay for the insurance schemes is set at ₹69,515.71 crore.
Ours is a Government fully committed to furthering welfare of farmers. We are proud of all our farmer sisters and brothers who work hard to feed our nation. The first Cabinet of 2025 is dedicated to enhancing prosperity for our farmers. I am glad that key decisions have been… — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 1, 2025

This decision aims to provide greater security for farmers' crops and relieve their concerns regarding crop damage.
newTitle: PM Modi Announces New Year Decision for Farmers on Crop Insurance Schemes

‘Wanted to protect them’—Agra man who allegedly killed mother, sisters in ‘confession’ clip before arrest - ThePrint
summary:
Man Confesses to Killing Mother and Sisters in Chilling Social Media Video

Date & Source: 16 August 2022, The Print

In a shocking turn of events, a 24-year-old man from Agra, Arshad, has confessed to murdering his mother and four sisters in a video uploaded to his social media account. The bodies were found in a Lucknow hotel on Wednesday.

  • The accused, Arshad, claimed that his neighbours were plotting to grab his house and sell his sisters.
  • He also claimed he wanted to convert to Hinduism and turn his shop into a Ram temple but received no help from the authorities.
  • Arshad's father, Bashar, was also heard in the video, suggesting his possible complicity.
  • Arshad was arrested after the video went viral, and the police confirmed his involvement in the crime.
"I wanted to adopt Hindu religion and convert my shop to a Ram temple...but nobody from the police and administration paid heed to my fervent pleas for police protection for myself and my family." - Arshad

ACP Hemant Kumar stated that Arshad had previously faced domestic violence allegations from his wife and had a history of bitter relations with his neighbours and relatives.

Read more about this tragic incident on The Print.
newTitle: Man Confesses to Killing Mother and Sisters in Chilling Social Media Video

title: Was Sanjay Raut assaulted by Shiv Sena (UBT) workers at Matoshree? Watch viral video - OpIndia
summary:
Sanjay Raut Allegedly Assaulted by Shiv Sena Workers at Party Meeting

Date: January 1, 2025, Source: OpIndia

On January 1, it was reported that Sanjay Raut was attacked by members of Shiv Sena (UBT) at Matoshree, Uddhav Thackeray's residence in Mumbai, during a party meeting.

  • Raut was allegedly assaulted and confined in a room by party workers.
  • The incident occurred in a meeting attended by Uddhav and Aaditya Thackeray.

  • This meeting was to discuss the party's poor performance in state assembly elections.
  • Raut had a contentious exchange with party members, leading to the altercation.
  • Neither Raut nor Uddhav Thackeray have publicly commented on the incident.
संजय राऊतला चोप दिला त्याची संपूर्ण माहिती ऐका!

This incident highlights internal conflicts within Shiv Sena (UBT) as they prepare for upcoming municipal elections amidst significant electoral challenges.

Big win for Modi government, trouble for Pakistan as extradition of 26/11 Mumbai attacks accused Tahawwur Ran - India.com
summary:
Significant Extradition Approval for 26/11 Mumbai Attacks Accused Tahawwur Rana

Publication Date: Recent

Source: India.com

In a significant win for Indian diplomatic efforts, Pakistani-Canadian Tahawwur Rana may soon be extradited to India for his alleged role in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, which resulted in around 175 fatalities. His extradition has gained momentum following a federal appeals court ruling in the United States.

Key Points

  • Tahawwur Rana is implicated in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.
  • His extradition was approved by the California-based Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals.
  • Charges against Rana include conspiracy, waging war, murder, and terrorism.
  • Rana had been previously sentenced to 14 years in a separate case.
  • He was released on compassionate grounds during the Covid pandemic.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The judgement mentioned Rana helping Headley get a five-year visa for India under the pretext of setting up a branch of his business there.

Rana’s extradition represents a step toward holding individuals accountable for their actions connected to the attacks.
newTitle: Significant Extradition Approval for 26/11 Mumbai Attacks Accused Tahawwur Rana

title: Inspection of Katra-Reasi rail link rescheduled to Jan 7, 8 - Greater Kashmir
Amid growing ties with Pakistan, Bangladesh army chief makes BIG statement on India, says can cooperate with - India.com
summary:
Bangladesh Army Chief: Fairness Key to India-Bangladesh Relations

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, India.com

Introduction: Bangladesh Army Chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman breaks his silence on the strained India-Bangladesh relations, emphasizing the importance of fairness and equality.

  1. India an ‘important neighbour’: General Zaman acknowledges India's importance and the interdependence between the two countries.
  2. Ties must be based on fairness, equality: He stresses that India-Bangladesh relations should be based on fairness to avoid perceptions of dominance.
  3. India, Bangladesh should protect each other’s strategic interests: The Army chief assures that Bangladesh will not act against India's interests and expects the same from New Delhi.
  4. ‘Historic’ mass movement led to Hasina’s fall: General Zaman calls the student protests that ousted Sheikh Hasina a historic event and expresses hope for a free and fair election.
  5. India-Bangladesh relations at all-time low: He acknowledges the current tense relations between the two countries.
“This must be based on fairness. Any country will want to get benefits from the other. There is nothing wrong in that. If we want extract our benefits, then we are to blame too. We must look into these matters. We have to maintain good relations based on equality. The people in no way should feel India is dominating over us, which goes against our interests. People should not feel this in any way,” he stated.

Conclusion: General Waker-Uz-Zaman's statement highlights the need for fairness and equality in India-Bangladesh relations, with both countries looking after each other's interests.
newTitle: Bangladesh Army Chief: Fairness Key to India-Bangladesh Relations

BJP planning to demolish worship places in Delhi: CM Atishi - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Planning Demolition of Worship Places in Delhi, Claims CM Atishi

Publication Date: January 01, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi accused the BJP of planning to demolish Hindu temples and a Buddhist worship place in the city, while promising support to religious leaders.

  • The Chief Minister claimed that a 'Religious Committee' ordered the demolition of six religious structures.
  • The BJP and Lieutenant Governor's office denied the allegations, stating no such orders were issued.
  • Atishi presented minutes of the meeting from the Religious Committee as evidence.
  • The affected locations include West Patel Nagar, Dilshad Garden, Sunder Nagri, Seema Puri, Gokal Puri, and New Usmanpur.
“The two-faced BJP has been exposed. On one hand, they claim to be defenders of the Hindus and on the other hand, they surreptitiously plan for demolition of temples.” - CM Atishi

The article outlines the growing tensions between the Delhi government and the BJP regarding the management of religious sites and raises concerns about potential political motivations behind the demolition plans.
newTitle: BJP Planning Demolition of Worship Places in Delhi, Claims CM Atishi

summary:
Delhi Cafe Owner Dies by Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Alleges In-Law Harassment

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

A 40-year-old businessman, Puneet Khurana, was found dead in his home in Delhi's Model Town in a suspected suicide linked to his ongoing divorce negotiations with his wife.

  • Puneet Khurana co-owned Woodbox Cafe with his wife, Manisha Jagdish Pawa.
  • His family alleges harassment by in-laws during divorce proceedings.
  • The police found his body following a call from his uncle.
  • A post-mortem is scheduled to determine the cause of death.
  • This incident follows another recent suicide case of a techie in Bengaluru.
“The family of the deceased made allegations of harassment against the deceased’s wife and in-laws.”

The tragic death raises serious concerns about the impact of familial disputes on mental health, especially in divorce situations.

‘Dual face of BJP’: Atishi accuses Delhi LG of ordering ‘demolition of temples’ in capital - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Dual face of BJP’: Atishi accuses Delhi LG of ordering ‘demolition of temples’ in capital

Date: Jan 01, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi has reiterated her allegations against Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena, claiming that several temples in the capital are set to be demolished following orders from a religious committee.

  • Atishi claims orders for demolition stem from a committee approved by LG Saxena.
  • Saxena denies the existence of such orders, accusing Atishi of “playing cheap politics.”
  • Atishi highlights the transformation of the religious committee’s authority, now reporting directly to the LG.
  • She alleges a meeting on November 22 decided the fate of several temples including those in West Patel Nagar and Gokalpuri.
  • Atishi concludes that the LG's office is misleading the public regarding demolition orders.
“The dual face of BJP is revealed through such orders. On one hand, they pretend to protect Hinduism, while on the other, they secretly instruct their appointed officers and LG to demolish temples.” - Atishi

In summary, Atishi’s accusations highlight significant political tensions regarding the authority and actions of the Delhi LG, which may impact religious freedoms and governance in the capital.
newTitle: Atishi Accuses Delhi LG of Ordering Temple Demolitions Amidst Political Tensions

title: Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC): Important Judgments By Supreme Court In 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC): Important Judgments By Supreme Court In 2024

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Live Law

As 2025 begins, Live Law summarizes important decisions on the Code of Criminal Procedure of the past year. Here are the key highlights:

  • Witness Statement Recorded In Absence Of Accused Can Be Used As Evidence If Conditions In S.299 CrPC Are Fulfilled : Supreme Court - The Court held that statements of prosecution witnesses recorded in the absence of the accused can be used as evidence if the accused was absconding.
  • Police Must Exercise Heightened Caution When Drawn Into Dispute Involving Unethical Transactions : Supreme Court - Police should ensure that criminal law remedies aren't misused over civil claims.
  • Case Of Accused Under S.313 CrPC Not Suggested To Victim In Cross-Examination; Supreme Court Refuses To Set Aside Conviction In Rape Case - The conviction cannot be set aside if the accused's statement regarding consent is not put forth during cross-examination.
  • High Court Must Not Hesitate In Quashing Criminal Proceedings Which Are Essentially Of Civil Nature - The High Court should quash criminal prosecutions arising from civil transactions.

...

Each decision contributes to the evolving interpretation and application of the CrPC in India, with implications for legal practitioners and the justice system.
newTitle: Key Supreme Court Judgments on CrPC in 2024

title: Deaths, deadly stunts, defiance mark New Year celebrations in Chennai - DTNEXT
Watch Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition As Trains Honk In Synchrony - News18
summary:
Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition: Trains Honk in Synchrony

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, News18

The iconic Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CST) station in Mumbai echoed with a symphony of train horns as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve, marking a unique tradition that has become synonymous with the station.

  • The tradition involves rail car sheds and locomotives simultaneously honking at midnight on New Year's Eve.
  • Commuters captured and shared the event on social media, with some users expressing surprise at the tradition while others noted its commonality.
  • Railway enthusiasts are credited with coordinating this event for several years, turning it into an eagerly awaited spectacle.
  • The atmosphere at the station on New Year's Eve is charged with joy and camaraderie, bringing people from all walks of life together to celebrate the railway heritage.
newTitle: Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition: Trains Honk in Synchrony
